questions.text: Assessment of insight is a part of the mental state examination in psychiatric practice. Regarding insight, which of the following statements is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Patients with schizophrenia will never have insight into their illness

options.label: B
options.text: OCD being a neurosis, insight is always intact

options.label: C
options.text: Intellectual insight is the highest level of insight

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of insight is similar to the concept of anosognosia in neurological illness

questions.correct_answer: D. Loss of insight is similar to the concept of anosognosia in neurological illness
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Loss of insight is similar to the concept of anosognosia in neurological illness Insight is closely related to the neurological symptom of anosognosia. A patient suffering from hemiplegia refuses to accept that he has lost the function of his limb. (‘A’- absence, ‘noso’ – ill health or disease, ‘gnosis’ – awareness.

Highyeild:

The three dimensions of insight proposed by David include: The ability to label unusual experiences as pathological To recognize that one has a mental illness To comply with the treatment

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect Options: Option: A. Patients with schizophrenia show variable levels of insight at various stages of their illness. Some exhibit a good level of insight when recovered, while at the worst phase of their illness, they may deny having any mental illness. Option: B. OCD being a neurosis, insight is always intact is a false statement. Option: C. Emotional insight is considered the highest level of insight. This is the awareness and understanding of the illness which leads to a change in behavior.

Extraedge:

Intellectual insight is the admission of illness and recognition of symptoms, without the ability to apply this knowledge to change or shape future behavior.

questions.text: Which of the following domains of cognition is tested by administering Serial Sevens Test?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Attention Serial sevens test is part of the Mini-Mental State Examination .

Highyeild:

In this test, the subject is asked to subtract seven from 100 serially five times . One point is given for each correct subtraction. Though it has arithmetic properties, in MMSE this test is primarily administered to test attention . Alternatively, the subject may be asked to spell the word ‘WORLD’ backward to test attention.

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect Options:- Option A: Recent memory is from a few seconds to minutes . It is checked by the attention and recall test. Option D: It is checked by a registration test.

questions.text: A depressed patient does not smile or laugh when a joke is shared by another person. She shows a defect in which of the following aspects of mental state examination?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Reactivity of effect Reactivity of effect refers to the change in effect in response to environmental cues. Lack of reactivity is common in depression .

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect options:- Option: A. Range of effect is characterized by the variety of emotional expressions noted in a session. Ordinarily, there are different feelings experienced at different times. Option: C. Congruity is the appropriateness of the person’s effect on the symptoms or the thought content. In this case, the effect is appropriate to the symptom of depression.

questions.text: According to Jaspers, the most important component of the psychiatric assessment is
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Empathy Empathy is an essential component to learn further about the pathological processes taking place in a patient.

Highyeild:

There are two essential components of descriptive psychopathology: The observation of behavior The empathic assessment of the subjective experience . The (2) was referred to by Jaspers as phenomenology and implies that the patient is able to introspect and describe his internal experiences and the doctor recognizes and understands the description.

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect options:- Option B: While humor may facilitate the process of clinical interview on certain occasions, it is not a necessary component of descriptive psychopathology.

questions.text: A 70-year-old male who is a known case of Alzheimer’s disease is brought with complaints of agitation, restlessness, and reduced sleep. While examination, the Psychiatrist asked the patient if he remembered which year his son was born. The psychiatrist is eliciting-
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Explicit memory. The Remote memory can be divided into Implicit memory Explicit memory: requires conscious attention to recall the events/facts.

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect options:- Option: A. Recent memory is from a few seconds to minutes . It is checked by the attention and recall test. Option: B. Immediate memory refers to the memory of a few minutes to days . A 24hr recall test can be done to analyze immediate memory. Option: C. Implicit memory is a type of remote memory that does not require conscious attention to recall. It includes skills, habits, and procedures.

questions.text: A 20-year-old male is brought by his mother as he is found talking to himself in his room and on questioning says he talks to his mentor who gives him commands and suggestions. He also doubts that his brother is trying to kill him and there have been multiple episodes of hitting and throwing things at his brother. He doesn’t talk much with his parents. True about this patient are-

options.label: A
options.text: Insight-absent, contact with reality- absent, judgment – impaired

options.label: B
options.text: Insight- absent, contact with reality- present, judgment – normal

options.label: C
options.text: Insight – present, contact with reality-absent, judgment- impaired

options.label: D
options.text: Insight- present, contact with reality- present, judgment- impaired

questions.correct_answer: A. Insight-absent, contact with reality- absent, judgment – impaired
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Insight-absent, contact with reality- absent, judgment – impaired The given clinical scenario points toward Psychotic disorder . The presence of hallucinations, and delusions are seen in the given clinical history. Hence Option B, C, and D are false
